page.syntax: Max_Length as N = max_str_length(C string ,C delimiter )

argument.name: string
argument.description: A string containing multiple separated values or words. Character

argument.name: delimiter
argument.description: The separator between the values or words. Character

page.description: Returns the length of the longest string in a list of strings
page.discussion: The MAX_STR_LENGTH() function returns the length of the longest sub string in the string.

section.description: This example shows how to figure out the maximum number of characters entered for a specific field for an entire table.
section.example: dim clist as C dim maxlen as N clist = table.external_record_content_get("table_name","field_name") maxlen = max_str_length(clist, chr(13)+chr(10))
